User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Nipher application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

signupDate.description: The date and time the user signed up.

lastLogin.description: The timestamp of the user's last login, used for session management.

blockedPaths.description: An array of navigation paths that are blocked for this user, used for role-based access control in the admin panel.

Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a private chat conversation between two or more users.

participants.description: An array of user UIDs participating in the conversation.

participantData.description: A map of participant data, keyed by UID.

status.description: The status of the conversation, acting as a support ticket state.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a single message within a conversation.

definition.description: Stores user data. The 'userId' parameter corresponds to the Firebase Authentication UID, ensuring path-based ownership and authorization independence.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user, matching the Firebase Authentication UID.

definition.description: Stores metadata for a single conversation.
Sub-collection storing all messages for a given conversation.

firestore.reasoning: The data structure is designed to store user information and conversations securely and efficiently. It prioritizes authorization independence by leveraging path-based ownership. The structure ensures that access control is straightforward and doesn't rely on complex hierarchical `get()` calls, which improves security and simplifies debugging. The segregation of user data into individual user documents and conversations into their own collections provides a homogeneous security posture for each user's information. This design facilitates secure `list` operations, as access is determined by the path structure.
